archetype_name: Family Hands-Off Sheet Pan & Slow Cooker Nights
name: Sheet-Pan Gemista-Style Beef & Rice Stuffed Peppers
description: Hands-off stuffed peppers baked in a tomato bath with cumin, cinnamon, lemon, and herbs. Uses ready basmati rice with quinoa for an easy family sheet-pan dinner with no chili heat.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F. Line a rimmed sheet pan or shallow roasting dish with foil.
Halve 4 large bell peppers lengthwise; remove seeds and membranes.
Finely chop 1 medium onion and a small handful of parsley.
Zest 1 lemon (save the lemon for serving if desired).
Microwave the basmati rice with quinoa pouch per pack directions to loosen (about 90 seconds).
Open the can/carton of crushed tomatoes.
cook_steps: In a large bowl, combine minced beef, warmed basmati rice with quinoa, chopped onion, chopped parsley, lemon zest, cumin, cinnamon, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Drizzle in 1 tablespoon olive oil and mix until evenly combined.
Spread the crushed tomatoes over the lined sheet pan to make a shallow sauce base. Season the tomatoes with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Nestle pepper halves cut-side up on the tomato base. Fill each pepper evenly with the beef–rice mixture, mounding slightly.
Drizzle the tops lightly with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Cover the pan tightly with foil.
Bake covered for 35–40 minutes, until the peppers are tender and the filling is nearly cooked through.
Uncover and bake 10–15 minutes more to brown the tops and finish cooking (internal temp of beef reaches 71°C/160°F).
Rest 5 minutes. Spoon the tomato sauce over the peppers to serve. Optional: squeeze lemon wedges over the top.

In a large bowl, combine minced beef, warmed basmati rice with quinoa, chopped onion, chopped parsley, lemon zest, cumin, cinnamon, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Drizzle in 1 tablespoon olive oil and mix until evenly combined.
Spread the crushed tomatoes over the lined sheet pan to make a shallow sauce base. Season the tomatoes with a pinch of salt and black pepper.

Bake covered for 35–40 minutes, until the peppers are tender and the filling is nearly cooked through.
Uncover and bake 10–15 minutes more to brown the tops and finish cooking (internal temp of beef reaches 71°C/160°F).
Rest 5 minutes. Spoon the tomato sauce over the peppers to serve. Optional: squeeze lemon wedges over the top.
